faqs: <dt class="text-base font-medium text-gray-900">What is backing?</dt><dd class="mt-3 text-sm text-gray-500">Guarantee, that an asset can be exchanged with a fixed amount of another asset(s). Note that there is no true guarantee and that every asset has its individual risk you need to asses.</dd>

<dt class="text-base font-medium text-gray-900">What is the backing ratio?</dt><dd class="mt-3 text-sm text-gray-500">The backing ratio displays the ratio between the sum of all backing and the market cap of an asset.</dd>

<dt class="text-base font-medium text-gray-900">What is the backing distribution?</dt><dd class="mt-3 text-sm text-gray-500">The backing distribution measures how uniform the backing is with respect to all backing assets. This is measured by the Kullback-Leibler divergence between the backing distribution and a uniform backing distribution.</dd>
